metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10251 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the jpc_pi_nextcprl function in jpc_t2cod.c in JasPerbefore 1.900.20 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via acrafted file, which triggers use of an uninitialized value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1.1
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-debian1-2.4ubuntu1.1').
